question: 断る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>cut off</kanji>. What happens when you do the action of cutting someone off? You're going <vocabulary>to refuse</vocabulary> them whatever it is they want.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Deciding <vocabulary>to refuse</vocabulary> something unfortunately starts a <reading>coat war</reading> (like a pillow fight, but everyone hits each other with coats instead of pillows). Coats to the ready, and let the coat war commence!
